arm_group.description: Patients with previous cardiac cath via the radial access who are planned for additional radial access cardiac cath

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess the feasibility of performing repetitive coronary
      angiograms via the radial approach

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility and Outcomes of Repetitive Radial Approach

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Patients with previous successful radial artery approach scheduled for elective
        transradial coronary angiography

        Exclusion Criteria:

        Lack of indication to perform radial approach Abnormal Barbeau test result (type C and D)
        Presence of radial artery occlusion Previous important trauma of the upper limbs Presence
        of fistula for renal dialysis Lymphoedema Acute myocardial infarction Refusal to sign the
        informed consent form

study_pop.textblock:
Patients with previous history of trans radial cardiac cath who are planned for additional
        trans radial cardiac cath

primary_outcome.measure: To assess patency of radial artery after repetitive radial artery access

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
